name: PythonScript
helpMarkDown:
The *Run Python command* task will let you enter any script or command to run with Python.

Consider using the *Python Script* task for inline code.
author: Steve Dower

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Script file to run. If omitted, the arguments below are passed directly.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments to Python. This should include at least a script filename, as well as arguments before and after.

inputs.name: workingdir
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where Python will be run.

inputs.name: abortOnFail
inputs.label: Fail on non-zero exit code
inputs.helpMarkDown: Aborts the build by failing this task if the script returns a non-zero exit code.

inputs.name: pythonpath
inputs.label: Python
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the `python.exe` to use. By default, the last install added by either the Install Python or Use Python task will be used.

inputs.name: dependencies
inputs.label: Dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Packages to install prior to running the script. Prefix with `--upgrade` to ensure you have the latest version.
